subtopic: Urban heat island and albedo changes
function_phrase: Don’t get hung up on the numbers—
main_point: The professor explains Urban heat island and albedo changes and how to interpret evidence when measurements can be misleading.
detail1: The professor distinguishes bioaccumulation (a process) from particulate (a proxy/measurement).
detail2: He suggests testing an asymmetric prediction involving albedo and trophic level.
attitude: Casual but analytical; he warns against over-trusting a neat correlation.
organization_point: He adds a tangent about a funding detail to show real-world constraints.
connecting_point: The example about controlling for hypoxia shows how bias can flip an apparent pattern.
